intro: Acosta tartarea, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Acosta tartarea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
